title: Ashland Was Set to Be a Food Paradise. Then Came the Almeda Fire.
description: Two years ago, the Almeda fire tore through southern Oregon. Many people havenâ€™t fully recovered, but farmers, chefs and others have rallied to sustain the area.
dc:creator: Brett Anderson
media:credit: Joe Kline for The New York Times
media:description: Sarah Cook, the chef at Nama, moved from Texas to southern Oregon, where wildfires are a perennial problem.
